title: Seeking Divine Justice
review: Golu Devta temple in Champawat, Chitai near Almora [~9Kms] is one of its kind temple based on the folklore of scion of Rai dynasty of Dhumakot around 15th century AD. People of Kumaon and nearby places have immense faith in the help one can get for relief from any kind of pain, humiliation and injustice. A large number of petitions are hung/strung up by desirous appellant throughout the year. It is wondrous that people of all faith use crumpled papers to stamped paper for submitting their grievances. The thousands of hanging bells are seen in the complex as offered by satisfied devotees.  The mystical and incredible faith in Golu Devta, considered to be an incarnation of Gaur Bhairav[Shiva],  is seen to be believed. Easy to visit from Almora town by bus or share taxis which are available during all day/evening. For devotee puja materials are available in stores nearby and afterword one can break fasting in food stalls. During Dussehra a large number of devotee come to pay their respect. Currently many such temples dedicated to Golu Devta can be found in Kumaon.

title: Sacred temple intertwined with local folklores
review: Chitai temple is a locally sacred shrine for Golu Devta, a deity associated with several local myths and folklores. Within 10 kms of Almora, this holy place receives a lot of footfall and devotees hang bells to seek divine blessings. As usual with several temples of the Himalayas, monkeys are abundant. However, there is nothing much to explore in terms of architecture, historical or archaeological importance etc. (for that visit Jageshwar). If you are travelling to Binsar / Dhaulchhina from Almora or vice-versa, Chitai Golu Devta temple can be a halting point. There are several eateries around, but all are vegetarian. Try the local pakoda-like fry, the chutney is lip-smacking. There is no parking, but you can always find ample space to park your car beside the road around the temple.

title: Nice Temple
review: This temple too is quite old and is located right on the highway. There are over 10000 bells tied in this temple and is really amazing. Worth a visit

There are many bells and letters to Lord Gollu Devta, even copy of government documents to as wish to complete. A must visit temple in Almora.

title: excellent tourist place
review: Chitai Temple is dedicated to Golu Devta .The temple is one of the popular temples of Lord Golu.It is considered as the god of justice.Per day hundreds of believers submit their wishes on paper in his temple. They think that the Lord of fairness will accept all requests which are made with a clean conscience. When the wishes are fulfilled, devotees express their happiness and gratitude by tying bells around the temple premises.The temple looks distinct and extraordinary with the presence of numerous bells of all sizes. Lord Golu’s shrine is placed at a position from where one can see amazing vistas of Himalayas. It is a must visit place which would introduce the visitor to a different kind of religious practice and devotion.

title: If you are going through a legal battle, this is where you should come!
review: Chitai Temple is a temple dedicated to Golu Devta, the lord of justice. It is a belief that if you have a court case going on and you tie a bell with the wish written on the piece of paper, the wish will be granted and you have to come within an year of your wish being fulfilled to tie the bell again. It was a beautiful sight with bells around totally worth visiting.

title: Temple visit

title: Make your wishes come true
review: Chitai Temple is devoted to the mythological and ancient God of the Kumaon region, Golu Devata or Lord Golu. Perched on a hilltop, this temple changed into built in the 12th century via the use of a large belonging to the Chand dynasty. Golu Devta is famously regarded as God of Justice.  located interior thick wooded location of the  pines and oak, this temple is an important non secular attraction of the region. Devotees in flip provide bells and sacrifice animals after the success in their wishes. lots of bells may be visible putting over the temple premises. Temple partitions are blanketed with courtroom stamp papers, which can be petitions from devotees who've not were given justice inside the court docket.

title: Beautiful temple but beware of monkeys around

Visitors usually buy metal bell or just write their wishes on a piece of paper. I have seen people writing their wishes on stamp papers as well. I am sure their wishes must have come true that's why it's so popular among locals and visitors.

review: The Golu Devta Temple at CHitai, near Almorah, Uttarakhand, is unique in its way. It has thousands of bells made of brass across its compound. The devotees offer bells to Golu Devta. You can also find bunch and bunch of letter written to the Devta for fulfilling the wishes of the devotees. Some letters have also been written on the stamp papers. It is an amazing site to see.

title: Colourful & unique temple
review: The temple is truly unique in the way that it's full of bells tied all through its premises. The colourful sight of so many bells and the sound they make is unique experience. Must visit place for me.

title: Daytrip to the Temple of Justice
review: A fascinating place- People from all over India travel to this very small village in the hopes of seeking justice by tying their grievances & hopes in written form to clanging bells at this temple.

title: Jai Golu Dev
review: Being a Pahadi I really enjoy each and every temple of the Golu Devta in our region. Golu Devta are the God of Uttrakhand. We show our devotion by offering bells to Golu Devta and one can easily find n number of bells in every Temple of Golu Devta.

title: Bells..Bells..and Bells...
review: Must visit for the Bells. It is situated on the way from Nainital to Chaukori. There is a small Golu Devta temple just a km before this in the forest of pine woods. Many takes break here to rest as the shades and trees of pine woods is accessible and one can seat below it. Golu Devta is the God in this region of Uttarakhand (Kumaon). The temple situated on a small hill across the road. One needs to climb up say 50 plus steps to reach at top. The steps are good and easy to climb. The temple starts with Bells, bells and bells all around including above your head. Climb up ringing the bells and appreciating the scene listening to the echoing sound of the bells. Every Golu Devta temple is having lots and lots of bells attached to all the pillars. It seems it is tied as a tradition, as a gratitude or request for wish to God.  One can also find thousands of people's wishes on papers and sometimes on stamp papers hanging all around. good to visit. As a visitor one enjoys the cluster of bells spread all along the temple capturing every pillar, boundary and every nooks and corner. There are no toilets in the temple premises nor did we find it near by the temple.

title: Amazing temple with thousands of bells and letters!!!
review: Chaiti Temple, located 6 km from Almora, is a sacred temple devoted to the mythological and historical God of the Kumaon region, Golu Devata. Perched on a hilltop, this temple was constructed in the 12th century by a general belonging to the Chand dynasty.The temple is characterized by the large number of bells hanging in the premises. These bells are hung by the devotees as offerings making a wish or in thanksgiving on the fulfillment of one’s wish.It is the most sacred temple for the people of Almora and the neighboring villages. The walls of the temple are covered with court stamp papers,letters by those who did not get justice in the court. Around the temple are hanging thousands of bells, which have been donated by those people whose wishes have, been fulfilled.

As such , it has a very large number of Bells of various sizes hanging in the path to the sanctum since time immemorial .

People come here with their wish , pray for justice, even they write their wish on a stamp paper and hang them with a bell of different sizes. Have never seen such an amazing scene. there big big bells as well as small , tiny bells. The deity is very simple  and is curved on a stone.  A very different experience.

Its on the way to Jageswar & accessible by taxi.

People who have issues that are not resolved otherwise, appeal in this temple for speedier resolution. Interesting. There are some nice restaurants and tea shops near by and opportunity to interact with locals.

title: Nice Temple - Presiding Deity of the Kumaon Hills
review: You will not miss this temple. On the way to Jageshwar site.

title: God is thier..
review: Too lovely and good place in almora.

title: Fascinating bells!
review: The bells that adorn the place (they are prayers to the almighty), give an amazing grace to this temple.

title: Golu Devta (God of Justice)
review: Very old temple of local deity known as Golu Devta (God of Justice) is very popular. Animal sacrifice is still considered as form of worship here, one must not visit this place if you find this troublesome or offensive.

title: Bells, Bells and more Bells
review: Chitai Golu Devta Ki Jai Ho !!!! you may never see more bells at one place any where else in the world....very interesting story behind the existence of this temple...go here just to see the amazing variety of bells....

title: very good temple for local community
review: i visit this temple such good location & very famous for local community..great temple & great location

title: Visit only if you have faith in lord Golu
review: This is temple of mythological God of Kumaun Region - Lord Golu.

title: Very good temple
review: Good temple to see. It is very famous among local residents. You must carefull during your visit here from monkeys, they can take your parsadam from you.According to this temple if any your wish fulfill ( you can write your wish on stamp paper / plain paper along with parsadam and fixup on any tree here )then you have to provide bell to this temple. You can see thousands of bells here.

title: Visiting the local deity in Devil Bhoomi!
review: Chitai temple is a temple of Golu Devta widely worshipped in Kumaon region. Golu Devta is believed to be a form of Lord Shiva and many mythological stories are believed around him.

title: Chitai Golu Devta temple
review: Temple with a lot of bells!! beautiful temple with a lot of historical significance. unique way of praying at the temple by tying bells of different sizes

title: Worth only for Believers
review: The temple is quite far from the city and there is nothing else around so visit this place only if you have belief in the deity. The temple is nice & clean and offers no special view .

title: a place must visit
review: must visit place in almora . you have a wish fix one bell . you may write a letter to Golu Devta also

title: Unique experience..
review: Its a very different temple, you'll find hundreds of bells in all sizes and here you can wish in writing.. its better to go early in morning to avoid rush and have breakfast in near by shops after visiting the temple..

title: Bells galore (and monkeys)
review: Liked: The bell gallery which leads you from the entrance to the sanctum sanctorum.

title: Golu dev does need any review
review: Its near to Almora. Nearly 10 Kms from Almora. Drive is very thrilling, one must be very careful. Temple has lot of Monkeys and one must be careful with their stuffs and gadgets.

title: Nice temple with lots of bells.
review: Located at the outer side of city. Chitai Golu temple is known for its  rituals of writing letter to the God and presenting a bell's to the god. Location is good.

title: Most Revered Temple Of Kumaun Region
review: Chitai Golu Devta Temple Is one of the most revered & most worshiped temples of Kumaun Region... Golu Devta is also known as Lord of Justice & is an incarnation of Lord Shiva... The temple is very peaceful where one can sit, worship & feel the peace of temple... there are numerous bells & letters hanging in all around temple, starting from the entrance.. people bring & also send by post their grievances & problems in the form of letters... when their problems are resolved by the grace of Golu Devta... people come & hang a bell as a gratitude towards the God... the size of the bell depends as per the financial capacity of the devotee... Golu Devta is the God of Justice therefore many people from around the world, mainly send the grievances of their court cases... Chitai Golu Devta Temple is a must visit for all travelers travelling to Almora...

title: simply bells
review: Chitai temple attracts locals with their offerings based on their fulfilled wishes ( mannath). The offering is a bell - one can see thousands of bells with letters attached on to the bells -

title: Write your heart and ring the bell!
review: The Golu Devta Chitai, temple is about 10 km. away from Almora. Golu Devta is a highly worshiped deity in kumaon region. People call golu devta as ‘God of Justice’.  You can see the impact and belief of this deity when you are travelling on road and come across lots of tourist and private cars bearing this name on the top of their windshields. Local folks have much faith in this temple and Golu devta, they visit here with their wish written on paper along with bell or for thanksgiving on the fulfillment one’s wish. There are thousands of bells, all different sizes are strung across the temple premises and stacks of paper along with that which have all funny requests / prayers right from passing in the exams to marrying off the daughter. Many people had written their wish or thanks giving on stamped paper. It was altogether different experience visiting Golu devta temple.

title: bell-temple
review: thousands of bells hanging at the temple-yard, good place for rest after a day-long journey...............................

title: Just another temple
review: It is just another temple with many bells and wishes clad to it's every wall. The thing I didn't like about this was that innocent animals are sacrificed here in name of God which is very wrong and one should avoid such places.

title: Jai Golu Maharaj....
review: Chitai Golu Devta temple is about 10 km from the Almora Jageswar/ Pithoragarh road. This temple is well known as “Ghanti Wala Mandir” or bell temple having thousands lakhs of bells around it. Golu Devata or Lord Golu is the legendary mythological and historical God of the Kumaun region and worshiped as Lord of Justice & is an incarnation of Lord Shiva... you can noticed number of petitions were hanging side by side with the bells on Rs 100 & 10 stamp papers and plain papers. Having patience you may see numbers of them are from different places of India and outside India…  A must visit place … enjoy

title: Temple of Local God of Justice!!
review: 1. We stopped on our way to Jageshwar to pay our respects to the deity Golu Devta.

title: Divinely Feelings
review: Some 10 kilometres from Almora, the Chitai Temple is considered to be a must visit place.  Here GOLU DEVATA, known to be an incarnation of Lord Shiva, regarded as the dispenser of justice, is worshipped here.  It is believed that Golu Devata cares for prompt justice to the devotees and may be because of that we here noticed many a written petition hanging to be received and be judged by the Lord.

title: Never seen so many bells in one place
review: Great place to go from Almora. Go with a wish. Come back with a bell if it is fulfilled. You see people making pacts with God on a stamp paper and letters. Lots and lots of bells of all sizes.

title: temple of miracles
review: This temple has 2 other sister temples at Champawat and Nainital.

title: Temple of wishes and Bells
review: This temple was first one of its kind among the temples we have been to in India. It is dedicated to their local God- Golu Devta- the God of Justice. People make wishes by writing them on the affidavit of rs 20 or more and tie them inside the temple premises. When their wishes come true, they tie Bells as a token of thanks to their God. It is near to Almora. Keep the camera with you. You will be delighted to see the faith in people in their God after reading their wishes. It was incredible. Loved it! :)

title: Chitai temple (bell temple)
review: Chitai temple is about 10 km from the Almora bus station on the Pithoragarh road. The temple has thousands of bells around it, there foe the temple is also known as bell temple, most of the foreigners know this temple as a bell temple. The temple a local gods temple. The temple well known for justice. Chitai god is known as Golu Devta.

title: Chitai Temple
review: worth a visit...but one should take care of their prasad plate as there are lots of monkey in temple premises...

title: Those bells are real attraction!
review: Beautiful temple surrounded by trees & hills.. will surely get some good shots for your camera! Best time to during evening!

title: Very peaceful, scerene
review: This temple shows the power of wishes and their coming true when you come with a pure heart. There are hundred's of thousands of bells which devotees have strung to the walls and this they do when what they wished for in the temple comes true. People come from thousands of kms away to prey. Worth visiting once and hopefully when your wishes come true you come visiting back again.

title: go, make a wish in writing
review: What a charming and well kept temple. People come here with written requests to Golu Devta and tie these request with a brass bell. Once you get what you wished for, remember to come and tie another bell. Long letters tied to the temple bells is a common sight, and you have to believe in the faith of the millions who have come to the temple before you. Do visit.

title: The most sacred and worshiped temple of Almora and Kumaon regeion
review: The Chaiti Golu Devta Temple is the most worshiped & sacred place of Kumaon regeion and the whole Almora..... This temple is also famous for its hanging bells which are thousands in nos... Its an old saying that those who are suffering from any problem & if they write their problems in letter to Golu Devta... they get instant rid of their problems.... A must visit place for all who visit Almora.....

title: DEVOTION
review: It's a highly worshiped temple of Kumaon Region... People throng from all over India here.... Plenty of Bells are there.. Chitai Golu Devta is the Isht Devt of Kumaon People... Chitai Temple is about 8 to 10 KM from Almora..

title: Ma Bell(e)
review: The Chitai temple is all about the local favorite-The Golu Devta. A God of justice and general WishMaster :)

title: Chitai Golu Devta... The Most Worshiped God Of Kumaon Regeion
review: Chitai Golu Devta Temple is situated at a distance of 8 KM from Main Almora... It is the most worshiped temple in the Kumaon Regeion... People call Golu Devta as the God of Justice... Thousands of people throng to this temple from all over india....

title: Bells, bells and more bells!
review: We stopped at this temple on the way to Jageshwar.

title: God of Justice-
review: I heard about this temple through relatives and then saw the coverage by famous indian news channel.Somehow I was determined to pay visit to this most trusted worship place of hindus.

title: gateway of Kumau
review: This temle is abt Golu Devta Chitai. this temple is about 4 km from the main gate of Binsar wildlife sanctuary & about 10 km. from Almora.

title: experience
review: This was our first temple - an experience to savour and learn from

title: thousands of bells for Golu devta...
review: the temple of Golu devta in Chitai almora is must visit, thousands of bells - different size / shape  all hung around as offering to god and written applications to god asking for justice ... some even on stamp papers ... myriad forms of belief and devotion .... incredible INDIA .... look around and be surprised and appreciate it ... it never ends..

title: Chitai Golu Devta-- An Incarnation Of Gaur Bhairav
review: Chitai Temple is dedicated to Golu Devta, an incarnation of Gaur Bhairav and is a local Kumauni god.. It is located Eight KMS from Almora. The deity of this sacred temple is reputed to make every wish come true, provided the worshipper ask for it with a clear conscience... All Golu Devta asks for in propitiation is a bell, as is evident from thousands of bells strung across the temple premises... The people of kumaun have immense faith in Golu Devta & he is the most worshipped God in Kumaun...Anyone can even seek Golu Devta's divine intervention by writing to him..Stacks of letters are pinned all over the temple along with the bells... Golu Devta is also known as God of Justice..

title: Its a bell temple..:)
review: if you want to see all the bells of world at one place then this is the place..:) he he...Nice temple..must visit for religious freaks..:)

title: bells  bells all the way:))
review: well basically the temple is so famous fotr the hanging bells all aroung...small..big bigger n smallest...every size of bells are hung there...a very nice temple where pandits wont try to suck u of ur money...u can sit n worship peacefully wihout any fancy n money wastage...olocation is so great :)

title: Bell temple..
review: After crossing some beautiful pine forests, comes this beautiful temple called Chitai. The temple is hung with bells of all shapes and sizes.

title: One bell -One wish
review: Gulu devta God of justice..... now place of wedding(Love marriage), Place of justice , place of wishes ........ in the Sivalik range of Kumoun a very famous temple....... good excursion near Almora (Uttrakhand )

title: Jai Chitai Golu Devta
review: As Almora is my home town  & Chitai Golu dev is our Isht dev. I normally goes to Chitai temple in my every visit.

title: The God of Justice
review: The complete name of Chitai Temple is "Chitai Golu Devta Temple" which is hardly at a disstance of 6-7 KM from main Almora Market. It's a very peaceful temple where Golu Devta is worshiped. Devotees send there problems in the letters via post to Golu Devta which are opened by the temple priest and are read to Golu Devta then these letters are hanged around the temple. When the devotees get rid of there problems they visit the temple and offer the bell to Golu Devta as per there capacity and pockets. It is a very famous temple in Almora.

title: beautiful picturesque temple
review: with golden bells of all sizes hanging around its such a beautiful temple......the stories which follows the temple makes it all the more intriguing...nice experience

title: Small but a different temple
review: This temple is for Golu Devta - a local deity. It is located about 5-6 Km from Almora city towards Jageshwar. Just on the side of the main road - it is a small temple but very popular in locals.

title: Its unique Temple
review: Plenty of Bells are there. Chitai Temple is very Unique in its way. Its a temple of Golu Maharaj. Don't try Tea or something more from nearby shops

title: The Bell temple!!!
review: This delightful small temple is full of bells... what is surprising is that some of the bells have petitions to god on court paper... small, medium and large bells all over the place...

title: Chitai Temple...The GOD of Justice...
review: Chitai Golu Devta Temple is situated at Almora Uttrakhand.... It's a highly worshiped temple of Kumaon Region... People throng from all over India here.... Plenty of Bells are there.. Chitai Golu Devta is the Isht Devt of Kumaon People... Chitai Temple is about 8 to 10 KM from Almora... After crossing some beautiful Pine Forests and huge mountains, comes this beautiful temple Chitai..People hand their griefs and sorrows in the form of letters here... and when their wishes are fulfilled they come back again and hang a Bell here,,, as per their capacity & pocket.... One must visit this temple once in the lifetime....

title: A place where Priests (pandas) don't harass you!
review: If you are religious minded you can try it. Won't get dissapointed.
